text:
Walter John Learning (November 16, 1938 – January 5, 2020) was a Canadian theatre director, playwright and actor. He was known as the founder of Theatre New Brunswick. He was born in Quidi Vidi, Newfoundland. He wrote a play based on the Christmas television special "A Gift to Last".
Learning died on January 5, 2020 at his home in Fredericton, New Brunswick at the age of 81.
